attributes.action: Free Prescriptions for all under 25s in full time education
attributes.background: It is currently free for full time students aged 18 and under to get prescription medication. I’ve just turned 19 and will now have to pay for my medication whilst being a full time university student, so it may become that I cannot afford it every month and forfeit my health due to financial issues
attributes.additional_details: Many students may not see their gp due to this. I think that a valid student ID should give exemption to paying for prescriptions when being a first time student. The age limit needs raising from 18 to 25 to account for this.

attributes.action: Regulate supported housing and hostels.
attributes.background: We need a regulatory body to license and oversee hostels and supported housing, including checking that support workers are trained, checking that licence agreements are fair, and offering a fair and impartial complaints procedure. Currently, owners get away with treating vulnerable adults unfairly.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people can find it difficult to understand their rights and make complaints. Proper regulation would mean that vulnerable people would be protected without having to fight to be treated fairly. I have been discriminated against and there was nothing I could do about it. A housing charity evicted me for not engaging enough, even though I have a severe anxiety disorder and another didn't deal with a complaint fairly and wasn't impartial.

attributes.action: Make vast changes to how the DWP treat people with mental health disorders
attributes.background:
DWP health assessments are a hellish experience for sufferers of mental health disorders. 
I suggest:
- Cutting wait time for assessments
- Own doctors do them
- DWP penalised if they cancel on the day
- Contact to be made more sensitively, in a way that won’t aggravate our conditions
attributes.additional_details: No allowances are made by the DWP for mental health conditions. They need to properly differentiate between physical and mental ability when noting our capabilities. An assessment with a stranger is incredibly difficult- it’s hard enough to tell family of our issues. Waiting for a DWP assessment is awful; weeks worrying about what’s to come. Two years now I’ve arrived and been turned away as they’re running behind, meaning I’ve had to suffer the anxiety of waiting all over again. Horrific.

attributes.action: Changes required under the Universal Credit to support workers!
attributes.background:
make uploading documentation for childcare costs or any other evidence available online - this will enable working families to upload in a timely manner!

monies to be paid in advance for childcare costs as ALL nurseries UK wide require advance payment!!
attributes.additional_details: I am a single mother to 2 under 3's who works as a manager but is newly single and having to rely on a system whether the childcare costs and housing costs have not been paid for the last 2 months leaving me in a very difficult situation that nobody else (IN WORK) SHOULD GO THROUGH!

attributes.action: Stop introducing fixed tenancies to tenants
attributes.background: New legislation is putting forward that fixed term tenancies will be given to everyone who is signing a new tenancy. This means tenants with existing secure tenancies will loose their secure tenancy example through mutual exchange and through the bidding system.
attributes.additional_details: Tenants are given opportunity to move through mutual exchange and being forced to give up their secure tenancy because they need extra space or to downsize. Now it’s a choice of quality of living or a secure tenancy. With these new laws coming in no one is secure people with vulnerability should be excempt from these laws. It would be better that those who need to move through mutual exchange should keep their existing tenancy status ie secure tenancy and move that over to the swapper property.

attributes.action: Re-run the appointments process for the board of the Office for Students
attributes.background: The Commissioner for Public Appointments has identified serious governance failings and political interference in the appointment of board members of the new Office for Students. All board members should be asked to immediately resign and the appointments process be re-run in  proper manner.
attributes.additional_details: The full report of the Commissioner can be accessed here: https://publicappointmentscommissioner.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Commissioner-for-Public-Appointments-Investigation-OFS-Final-.pdf

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Provide help for residents of Tawergha in Libya
attributes.background: There are around 35,000 people (who are an ethnic minority) who have been forced to leave their homes in the 2011 revolution by militias from Misrata. The UN-backed Tripoli Government promised their return to Tawargha on the 1st of February 2018, after 7 years of living in bad conditions.
attributes.additional_details: The militias have refused this government decision and blocked the roads to Tawergha by force. Now the people of Tawergha have built make-shift camps in Gararat Al-Gadaf which is near Bin Walid and Harawa which is near Sirte. On 5/02/2018 militias from Mistrata attacked the camp and burned some tents. On 12/02/2018 two people passed away and some children were admitted to Bin Walid hospital due to exposure to the cold. I am asking the British Government to provide assistance to these civilians.

attributes.action: Erase CCJ immediately from records once debts are fully paid.
attributes.background: A CCJ on record for 6 years can be the end of normal life for most. 6 months career break alone is dangerous, 6 years is destructive. That Mortgages will be lost, homes break under financial burden, people look to emigrate over a £300 registered debt is ludicrous & the judgements too easily applied.

attributes.action: Form a public holiday to celebrate our NHS; incl. all in the emergency services
attributes.background:
The NHS is one of our key British Values.

A NHS Day holiday in the summer would serve to underscore our deep admiration for all of those who work in the health and emergency services. With events celebrating its formation, those that serve and events to promote health and community.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is, if anything, one of our key British Values. Given this, is it not time to truly celebrate the NHS!?!?
This would allow a focus of public opinion and need for such a critical part of who we are as a nation, showing the world that this is who we are and what we hold dearest to our hearts. If ever there was a time to show how strong we all feel about the NHS it's now. What better way to do that than a public holiday focused around celebrating this bedrock of our society!

attributes.action: Raise income tax by 0.25%, ring-fenced for NHS and post-discharge social care.
attributes.background:
The NHS is at crisis point with A&E having patients in all corners and in a queue of ambulances outside It needs extra money to provide for good quality services and the type of social care that would help to stop bed blocking in hospitals.

Waiting lists for clinics  and tests are too long.
attributes.additional_details:
Most people I know would be prepared to pay more income tax as long as it is used as extra money for the NHS and social care to enable discharge from hospital when nursing is no longer needed.

Doctor and nurse staff morale is low because of the pressures in trying to care for sick people without the resources to do so.

Bed occupancy is at 94% in England which is not entirely due to influenza as elective surgery was cancelled to cover this. The NHS could not cope with a further crisis.

attributes.action: Make the National Speed Limit 80mph.
attributes.background: The motor way is used by drivers to get to further destinations quickly. Having a speed limit is already limiting its use and having an abundance of speed cameras is further limiting it. Making the NSL 80mph will at least contribute to a quicker journey time amongst all these other limitations.
attributes.additional_details:
More car accidents are had on regular roads.
Speed cameras are on many roads where crashes aren't even a problem. 
Amongst restricted parking, restricted roads and roads being flooded with traffic lights, traffic is a problem. Speed cameras further increase this as people slow down just for these cameras.

attributes.action: Ban the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Make all, or most left turn traffic lights into permanent 'GIVE WAY' junctions
attributes.background: In order to reduce emissions of the country, especially in cities, all filter traffic lights and wherever safe, turning left should be on a giving way to the flow of traffic on the road you're joining basis, this would reduce journey times, congestion, and the amount of traffic remaining stationary.
attributes.additional_details: This is guaranteed to reduce emissions on cars of all ages and fuel types, as well as saving fuel or battery power. This will also keep the aspect of safety given by traffic lights, for example, at a 4 way junction, traffic heading straight on or right would still be on a light based rotation.

attributes.action: Build Nuclear Bunkers sufficient for the population accounting for growth.
attributes.background: There is and always has been since creation a threat of nuclear attack, currently as individuals there is effectively nothing we can to protect ourselves from an attack for example from North Korea, in the event of nuclear attack millions of people would be helplessly destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: I would ask that the government ensure the construction regardless of the financial cost of nuclear shelters in major urban population centres for all persons of the area and accounting for influx of peoples to the shelters from outside of the area and population growth so that people can protect themselves from a nuclear attack, I would ask people be quickly and indiscriminately accepted into these shelters and essentials be available for prolonged life from within the shelter.

attributes.action: Debate the United Kingdom's recognition of Kosovo as an Independent Country.
attributes.background: I believe Kosovo was wrongly recognised as an independent country by the United Kingdom. The bombing campaign conducted by NATO in 1999 and Kosovo's separation in 2008, were unjust acts upon Serbia. This should be debated in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom wrongly recognised Kosovo's unilateral declaration of independence a day after it was declared on the 17th of February 2008. The unjust settlement was introduced without the agreement of both parties and a binding Security Council resolution. Serbia’s sovereignty was thus undermined and disrespected in the process. Therefore, the declaration of independence by Kosovo can be argued to be an unlawful secession and needs to be debated in parliament once more.

attributes.action: Fund a permanent memorial to soldiers killed in Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
On the 5th April 1979 Trooper Anthony Dykes along with Trooper Anthony Thornett of the Blues & Royals were killed in action whilst serving their country.

763 people gave the ultimate sacrifice in Northern Ireland whilst serving their country yet there is no permanent memorial to this.
attributes.additional_details:
My Grandparents are now in the later years of their life and have fought tirelessly for this to happen,they did a piece for ITV which I include a link below to:
http://www.itv.com/news/calendar/2017-03-27/couple-campaign-for-memorial-to-soldiers-killed-in-northern-ireland/

We owe it to those who gave their lives for their country to be honoured, I never had the chance to meet my Uncle but I am immensely proud of him for the sacrifice he gave to our country.

attributes.action: Mandatory 5 year prison sentence for carrying a knife on the first offence
attributes.background: The streets of the United Kingdom have been lost to knife wielding thugs who suffer  little or no consequence for their actions. Social media and local news is awash with videos and images of knives on our streets. The two strike rule has failed. A mandatory 5 year sentence must be enforced for all.

attributes.action: Address the quality of food being served to patients in NHS hospitals.
attributes.background:
The current state of food in both general and mental health hospitals is very poor. 
The fresh frozen produce being served across many NHS hospitals is costly, unappealing and wasteful. 
I believe that this needs to be addressed as it is impacting on people's physical and mental recovery.
attributes.additional_details:
I have seen first hand the quality of food which is served to patients and the amount of waste it creates.
 
When good quality food is fresh and appealing it has a massive impact on a patient’s recovery time which helps to reduce the time spent in hospital.

attributes.action: Let women set a cap on how much they will claim from the father of their child
attributes.background: The law disregards agreements made by women who conceive via sperm donation without using a clinic. This puts men who help them at risk of getting a huge bill. Many are deterred; among them those who could bring most to the self-image, aspirations and aptitudes of the children.
attributes.additional_details:
A legally recognised ‘limit of liability’ would give security to the donor while allowing scope for some agreed financial contribution. This could:

avoid the need for secrecy and anonymity

provide more money for poorer families

make sperm donation a practical alternative to getting pregnant in an unsatisfactory or short-term relationship

start a virtuous circle of better donors and higher regard for sperm donation

For comments, questions and discussion please go to:

limitofliability.blogspot.co.uk

attributes.action: Make the House of Lords appointment process fully independent from government.
attributes.background: Peers are appointed by the Queen on the prime minister's advice. Some members are recommended by an independent body, called the House of Lords Appointments Commission, but only for non-party-political individuals. This process allows government to tip the balance in the Lords for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
The government's power to select members of the House of Lords, leaves the Chamber open to unethical appointments, for example the recent selection made by Prime Minister Theresa May, which appears to be an attempt at quelling opposing voices inside government: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-44167066
This should never be allowed. A fully independent body must be set up to elect peers to the House of Lords.

attributes.action: Include an engine noise emissions measurement in the MOT of motor vehicles.
attributes.background: Engine noise of some vehicles, particularly motor bikes, has reached offensive levels.

attributes.action: The N.H.S should fund properly regulated homeopathy clinics.
attributes.background: Millions around the world and in the U.K choose homeopathy instead of mainstream medicine, until recently the N.H.S funded some G.P's who prescribed homeopathic remedy's but the N.H.S has now stopped this.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens the right to a non-binding vote on parliamentary debates.
attributes.background:
Citizens already have the right to view almost all parliamentary debates online. 

Add a simple voting mechanism for the public to vote.

Build digital infrastructure on parliament.uk which allows those with UK citizenship a non-binding vote (‘aye’/‘no’/abstain) on all debates in parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a crude solution to the issue of representative democracy versus direct democracy in the UK. 

Many citizens feel as though a vote on who should represent them in parliament every five years isn’t democratic enough.

If you think the proposed system
is better than the current system, sign this petition.

attributes.action: Apology from British government for 1919 Jallianwala Bagh Massacre in India
attributes.background: On 13 April 1919, Col R. Dyer of British Indian Army ordered soldiers to fire onto a crowd of pilgrims gathered in Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar, India to celebrate the holy festival of Baishakhi. Dyer got all exits blocked to deliver maximum fatality killing hundreds of innocent unarmed civilians
attributes.additional_details:
Well documented incident which is the worst among many crimes committed by the colonising British. The pre-planned massacre puts the official deaths as 387. Dyer admitted that 1650 rounds were fired into a trapped crowd including elderly, kids and women. Unofficially casualties are estimated to be over 1000.

On the centenary of this horrific crime, the british government must tender an apology to the people of India in 2019

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jallianwala_Bagh_massacre#The_massacre

attributes.action: Introduce a national agency to perform detailed 'anti-money laundering' testing
attributes.background:
Anti money laundering (AML) checks are required by banks, and also legal advisers, accountants etc
Given a desire to reduce the UK as a destination for 'dirty money' rules could be tighter
AML checks are hard to carry out meaningfully and are already time consuming
attributes.additional_details:
A single agency could improve on the status quo by:
- removing duplication
- unbiased approach
- removing competitive pressures to cut rigour ('all our other [x] accepted this, why don't you?')
- speeding up transactions by pre-approval
- ability to see full picture of all UK investments when testing source of funds

Scheme could be self-funding by charging fees

Data security:
- replace info being gathered and held by multiple parties
- no need to disclose full details when issuing certificate

attributes.action: Free prescription charges in England
attributes.background:
Why should people in England be charged for prescriptions?
Why can the rest of the "United Kingdom" be exempt the same as Wales Scotland, Northern Ireland.
This is direct discrimination against anyone living in England.

attributes.action: Record homeless death statistics at local and national levels
attributes.background: According to the guardian, the number of homeless deaths on Britain’s streets has more than doubled since 2013, yet the extent of the problem is not known as neither the government nor local authorities are required to keep statistics on this. By understanding the problem, it can be better tackled.
attributes.additional_details: On 11 April 2018, Patrick Greenfield and Sarah Marsh wrote in the guardian that the number of homeless people dying on the streets of Britain has more than doubled in recent years, but the true extent of the problem could be much higher as there is no national or locally recorded official statistics measuring this. To better understand and help to tackle this issue, statistics on the number of deaths of homeless people on the streets of Britain should be recorded.

attributes.action: Ban people from smoking inside all local authority/ association owned houses
attributes.background:
Banning smoking in local authority/association owned houses will reduce passive smoking which other people in the property do not want to inhale. 

It will reduce the amount of fire damage that could occur if the cigarette isn't extinguished properly
attributes.additional_details:
It can stop potential nuisance of litter been thrown from windows into neighbours gardens and the street better for the environment and less encouragement to rats 

May reduce smoking rate so people may quit and become healthier

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence not to report child abuse
attributes.background: If children report abuse to an adult, including a family member, that adult must be required by law to report it to the police. Too many families choose to keep quiet to protect their (family) honour and/ or careers and let the defenceless child suffer.

attributes.action: Introduce a South African Vulnerable Persons' Resettlement Programme
attributes.background:
- 1,700 people have been killed in farm attacks in two decades 
- In 2016/17 torture was used in 17.6% of murders 
- the South African Parliament decided in Feb to approve a motion in favour of “the expropriation of [white-owned] land without compensation”.
attributes.additional_details:
- In 2014 Britain established the Syrian Vulnerable Person Resettlement Programme (VPRP). Since June 2017 all those admitted to the UK under the VPRP have been granted refugee status. 
- We therefore merely call for equal treatment by the British government for South Africa.”

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: Disallow Schools To Confiscate Mobile Phones
attributes.background: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate items such as mobile phones. Mobile Phone are necessary to a child's learning, it lets the student to enhance the internet, release stress, contacts friends for social support and let's parents and carers now where their child is and if they are ok.
attributes.additional_details: Yes, Phones can be a distraction meaning students must not use them in class but a teacher must not confiscate them. What are students suppose to do if they are in trouble walking home? What if they need to go to a friend's due to an emergency? What if the parent needs to contact the child but does not know where they are and who to ring?

attributes.action: Publish clearer guidance about speed limits for Vans as they are currently wrong
attributes.background:
The Road Traffic Act 1988 section 185 , 1 (b) defines the majority of van's currently on the road as a "motor car".

So schedule 6 speed limits do not apply to the majority of Vans.

I believe your guidance on Car-derived vans and dual purpose vehicles portray's incorrect speed limits for van's
attributes.additional_details:
Please see important website information and other petitions

http://bentcop.boards.net/thread/160/petition-government-clarity-speed-limits

attributes.action: Have a UK passport only channel in U.K. airports.
attributes.background:
Every time I fly throughout the year I am constantly in a huge queue to enter my home country!
It is so frustrating to have a UK/EU passport channel where 75% of the people are not UK citizens. We are one of the only countries where our own citizens queue to come HOME.
attributes.additional_details:
We shouldn’t have to be in a long queue where most of those are EU not U.K. citizens. Priority should be given to British passport holders just as every other country does by having U.K. passport ONLY lanes too.
Even the queues for non EU/UK passports is often smaller and quicker and it’s really a kick in the teeth to queue when in other counties airports at the border and then also at the border when you get home!

attributes.action: Set a legal maximum stake of £2 for fixed odds betting machines (FOBTS)
attributes.background:
Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this

B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds. There should be a legal maximum stake of £2 to protect people who are addicted to gambling.
attributes.additional_details:
Betting can be fun, but addiction isn't.
 
When the fun stops, stop. The fun has stopped - there are over 400,000 problem gamblers, with more than 2 million 'at risk' - so stop the FOBTs.
 
A £2 maximum stake (as already is in place on b3 games/ 'slots') would still allow serious, but stable gamblers to  win big, but not on the 'crack-cocaine' of gambling. 

We call on the Government to take this action to protect vulnerable people and to fix the problem in gambling.

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for using physical violence or brandishing weapons.
attributes.background: On a regular basis my colleagues and I are subjected to physical aggression and attacked in the course of our lawful duty. We want minimum custodial sentences brought in so when we are attacked in our workplace or have weapons brandished against us we will have confidence in the justice system.
attributes.additional_details:
On 3 seperate occasions I personally have had knives pulled on me during the execution of warrants issued by HMCTS. On 2 occasions the police refused to arrest as they said there is no point and on the 1 occasion they did the offended was issued a £50.00 fine (which they never paid) with no other punishment at all. 

This is a story that is all too common in our workplace and I feel a minimum sentence should be introduced to provide justice to all frontline workers attacked or threatened.

attributes.action: End PFI in the NHS
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, are disappointed that the Prime Minister has not ruled out the possibility of US companies having any involvement in the NHS as part of a post-Brexit trade deal with the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
We are concerned that allowing such involvement will lock the British taxpayer into long-term debt, especially should any NHS trust involved require additional funding.

We are further concerned that the needs of private financiers and banks will dictate the shape, size and scale of our health services and that the high costs of PFI debt charges means that the NHS will be unable to operate as it would have done through conventional procurement funding.

We therefore call upon the British Government not only to rule out US or any other foreign company involvement in the NHS post-Brexit but to commit to no extension to or further PFI funding arrangements across all NHS services.

attributes.action: more funding for schools to tackle mental health issues in staff and students.
attributes.background: We want schools to gain more access to mental health facilities that can greatly benefit their staff and students. Many people suffer in silence because of the lack of support that they can get, we want to change this to make sure that nobody suffers alone. This may include onsite counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health can change the way in which you take in information and how you perform in your daily life. This can affect the way that staff will teach and how the students make progress in their examinations. Mental health issues can often lead to you not doing mandatory things such as eating and getting enough sleep, these are very important factors needed to continue a healthy lifestyle.

attributes.action: Keep the Panavia Tornado in service for another few years
attributes.background: The Tornado is one of the most capable and advanced strike aircraft currently fielded by any air force today, and RAF Tornados are currently conducting airstrikes on insurgents in the Middle East, and the Tornado will be kept in service by Germany until 2025, so why can’t we?

attributes.action: Devolve responsibility for immigration policy in Scotland.
attributes.background: It looks like the EU migrants are now leaving the UK after Brexit and we don’t want that.  So, I call on the UK government to devolve some powers over immigration, especially the responsibility over immigration policy to the Scottish Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: We, Scots welcome immigrants to come and live in Scotland, and work in Scotland, when England doesn’t.  We welcome especially EU migrants, who pay their taxes raised in Scotland and contribute to our economy and if they go, we will miss out.  So we need them.  I know we haven’t known about this before, but countries like Canada and Australia have regional/provincial immigration policies within a nation-wide framework.

attributes.action: Remove variable speed cameras or only put them in action for emergencies
attributes.background: The removal of the variable speed cameras would cut congestion dramatically it will also prevent as many crashes in these areas from people slamming their brakes on when they approach a ridiculous 40mph
attributes.additional_details: When the cameras have been off over Christmas no traffic at all on the m4 past Newport at the same time when the cameras are in action you can expect tailbacks that also cause high emissions from stop start traffic caused by these variable limits they should either be removed or only used if there are lanes blocked

attributes.action: Keep accepting credit card payments for all tax payments
attributes.background: The Government are stopping accepting credit card payments from 13th January 2018 - please sign to keep the acceptance of credit card payments after this date.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owner

attributes.action: Stop charging for Vehicle Excise Duty
attributes.background:
The government wastes taxpayer money by collecting vehicle excise duty in the form of a tax on the car.
Instead the revenue currently generated through VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year £100 million worth of VED goes unpaid through evasion.
Car insurance and MOT details are now held on a central register so the outdated requirement to provide these documents when taxing a car is un-necesaary. 
VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold, this would create a simple and unavoidable way of collecting the revenue. It would also encourage people to buy fuel efficient cars therefore helping the environment.

attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in Children's Homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013) on average £133,000 - £148,000 per child per year, yet it will cost a parent approximately £25,000 - £30,000 per year to send their child to a top boarding school to receive the best education money can buy, and those that attend boarding school don’t end up in prison. This is one of many viable solutions to consider

attributes.action: To stop companies selling debts to debt collection companies
attributes.background: Want it so companies eg mobile phone companies can’t sell a debt on to debt companies who then add extortionate charges and use heavy handed tactics. The contract is between the company and the person who takes out the contract, making that contract a legal document.

attributes.action: Allow current part time students to apply for the new part time maintenance loan
attributes.background: the new provision to allow new part time students eligible for a maintenance portion of student finance, is unfair to legacy & distance learners, currently if you are a part time distance learning student you do not qualify for the maintenance loan unless you have a disability & are a new student
attributes.additional_details: the rules for part time maintenance loans need to be standardised across the board and student who are currently 1 or 2 years into their degree should be treated equally with those who are just applying to start their degree.  additionally only part time distance learners who are disabled are eligible for the maintenance loan, i propose that the rules are brought in line across the board and made available to all students without discrimination to existing students.

attributes.action: Bring in free bus pass concessions at age 60 in England.
attributes.background:
Free bus travel is available to people from aged 60 in Scotland, Wales and Northern ireland
The date at which you can apply for a bus pass in England is state pensionable age (currently 2023) if you are now age 60. This is geographical discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: A Senior Railcard is available to anyone aged 60 or over. There should be no distinction in age for a concession on bus or rail transport, or where you live in the UK. All transport concessions should be from age 60 regardless of where you live in the UK.

attributes.action: Make high blood pressure tablets free on the NHS
attributes.background: Over 5 million people have high blood pressure and it affects more than 1 in 4 adults and is one of the biggest risk factors for premature death and disability in England.High blood pressure can lead to diseases including heart disease, stroke, vascular dementia and chronic kidney disease.
attributes.additional_details: People who treat their diabetes with tablets, injection therapies or insulin are entitled to free prescriptions – but if you're in England you'll need to have a medical exemption certificate to claim your free prescription unless you're aged 60 or over. High blood pressure affects more people and have the same potential to kill a sufferer as someone with diabetes. High blood pressure sufferers right across the UK should be treated equally and fairly as diabetics and get free medication
